metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16844 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
nginx before versions 1.15.6 and 1.14.1 has a vulnerability in the implementation of HTTP/2 that can allow for excessive CPU usage. This issue affects nginx compiled with the ngx_http_v2_module (not compiled by default) if the 'http2' option of the 'listen' directive is used in a configuration file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16844` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

nginx - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
nginx-common - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
nginx-core - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
nginx-extras - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
nginx-full - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
nginx-light - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nginx package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.3').
